revisions.rev:
[[Image:Location Ireland EU Europe.png|thumb|Location of Ireland]] Various '''commerative coins denominated in Irish currency''' were issued up until 2002, when the [[Irish pound]] (IEP/IRÂ£) came to an end and was superseded by the [[euro]]. Since then there have been [[Euro gold and silver commemorative coins (Ireland)|Irish commerative coins denominated in euro]]. ==10 Shilling== {|class="wikitable" width="100%" |- | rowspan=3 width="330px" nowrap align=center | [[Image:Irish ten shilling coin.png|160px]] | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Topic:''' [[Easter Rising|Easter rising of 1916]] | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Designer:''' T. Hugh Paget |- | align=center | '''Value:''' 10s | align=center | '''Alloy:''' .8333 Ag (.4858 oz) | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 2,000,000 20,000 | align=center | '''Quality:''' Reg Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 1966 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' 28.6 mm | align=center | '''Weight:''' 18.14 g | align=center | '''Market Value:''' - |- | colspan="5" align=left | 1,270,000 of the [[Ten shilling (Irish coin)]] were melted in 1971. |} ==50p== {|class="wikitable" |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Topic:''' Dublin Millennium | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Designer:''' Thomas Ryan |- | align=center | '''Value:''' 50p | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Cu 750 Ni 250 | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 5,000,000 50,000 | align=center | '''Quality:''' Reg Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 1988 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' - | align=center | '''Weight:''' 13.5g | align=center | '''Market Value:''' - |- | colspan="5" align=left | The obverse depicts the Irish harp The reverse design features the Coat of Arms of the City of Dublin & the Coat of Arms of the Lord Mayor of Dublin |} ==Â£1== {|class="wikitable" |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Topic:''' 50th Anniversary of the United Nations | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Designer:''' - |- | align=center | '''Value:''' Â£1 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925 | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 25,000 Authorised (2,750 actual mintage?) | align=center | '''Quality:''' Proof - |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 1995 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' 38.61 mm | align=center | '''Weight:''' 28.28 g | align=center | '''Market value:''' - |- | colspan="5" align=left | The obverse depicts the Irish harp and the dates 1945 and 1995. The reverse design features a dove carrying in its beak a banner announcing the anniversary dates of 1945 and 1995. |- | colspan="5" align=left |   |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Topic:''' Millennium | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Designer:''' Alan Ardiff & Garrett Stokes |- | align=center | '''Value:''' Â£1 | align=center | '''Alloy:''' - | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 5,000,000 95,000 | align=center | '''Quality:''' Reg Proof |- | align=center | '''Issued:''' 2002 | align=center | '''Diameter:''' 31.1 mm | align=center | '''Weight:''' 20 g | align=center | '''Market value:''' - |- | colspan="5" align=left | The obverse depicts the Irish harp. The reverse design features the [[Broighter Gold|Broighter Boat]] that dates from the first century BC. |} ==European Currency Unit (ECU)== {|class="wikitable" |- | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Topic:''' Irish European Community Presidency & European integration | colspan="2" width="50%" align=center | '''Designer:''' Thomas Ryan |- | align=center | '''Value:''' 5ecu | align=center | '''Alloy:''' Ag 925 | align=center | '''Quantity:''' 20,000 -
